newsitem.title: KENYA: RALLYING-MCRAE WINS SAFARI RALLY AND TAKES CHAMPIONSHIP LEAD.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING-MCRAE WINS SAFARI RALLY AND TAKES CHAMPIONSHIP LEAD.

text.p: Briton Colin McRae won the Safari rally on Monday and jumped to the top of the championship standings.
McRae, driving a Subaru, finished seven minutes and four seconds ahad of fellow-Briton Richard Burns in a Mitsubishi.
McRae had taken the Safari lead at the start of the second day when the first day's overnight leader German Armin Schwarz fell back with a broken suspension.

From then, the 1995 champion dominated proceedings as he set the fastest time on four of the day's five stages despite attempts by spectators to sabotage his challenge by placing a wall of rocks in front of his car on the sixth stage.
That proved to be McRae's only serious difficulty, though he suffered a minor electrical problem on the final day.
Kenyan Ian Duncan, in a Toyota, came in third, 11 minutes and 18 seconds behind McRae.
